lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Duke is a Personal Assistant Chatbot that keeps track of various tasks.
/** A class to keep track of all tasks of the Duke instance **/
* Initializes a new Duke instance with specified filepath to store tasks
System.out.println("I'm afraid I don't recognise that, please try again!");
System.out.println("Did you forget to enter your task number?");
System.out.println("Sorry, that task does not exist!");
System.out.println("When is that due? Let me know after '/by'!");
System.out.println("When is the event happening? Let me know after '/at'!");
System.out.println("Oops, did you enter your date in yyyy-mm-dd format?");
* Makes sense of the user command
* Bridges communication between the user string and the tasks
/** Whether Duke should continue running after handling **/
/** Current user string split into words **/
* Handles / parses user input, and allowing interactions with tasks
* @param taskList TaskList object used by Duke
* @throws DukeException If Duke does not recognize the format provided
public static void handle(String userString, TaskList taskList) throws DukeException {
* Triggered when the done command is identified
* Marks the given task as done
* @throws DukeException If there is no task number or wrong task number
public static void handleDone() throws DukeException {
throw new InvalidTaskNumberException("Task does not exist");
* Triggered when the todo command is identified
* Adds a new Todo object to the TaskList
* @throws DukeException If no name is provided
public static void handleTodo() throws DukeException {
* Triggered when the deadline command is identified
* Adds a new Deadline object to the TaskList
* @throws DukeException If no name or no deadline is provided
public static void handleDeadline() throws DukeException {
* Triggered when event command is identified
* Adds a new Event object to the TaskList
* @throws DukeException If no task name or event date is provided
public static void handleEvent() throws DukeException {
* Deletes the task with the task number provided
* Triggered when delete command is identified
* @throws DukeException If there is none or invalid task number provided
public static void handleDelete() throws DukeException {
throw new InvalidTaskNumberException("Task does not exist");
* Prints tasks that match the user string
* Triggered when find command is identified
* @throws MissingTaskNameException If no task name provided
public static void handleFind() throws MissingTaskNameException {
* Duke class which handles interactions with user files for storage purposes
* Gets the file which stores tasks from the user's session
* If the file exists, it returns the file
* If the file does not exist, it creates and returns it
* @return Text file containing user session data
* Gets the user task file and writes a string to it
* Gets the user task file and appends a string to it
* TaskList handles the loading, storing and interactions with tasks
/** Storage instance for interaction with files **/
* Initializes a new TaskList with the given file path
* Filepath is used to initialize a Storage instance
* Adds a new task to taskArrayList
* @param task Task object to be added
* Retrieves the task with the corresponding ID
* Removes the task with corresponding ID
* Lists the current Tasks in taskArrayList with numbering
* Retrieves the number of tasks currently
* Retrieves a list of tasks from previous sessions, stored in data/duke.txt
* If file does not exist, it will be created
* Parses and adds tasks line by line to taskArrayList
* Saves the current list of tasks to data/duke.txt to be used in future sessions
* Finds and prints a list of tasks with matching task name
* @param taskName Name of task entered by user
* Class responsible for interactions with the user
/** Prints a message for when there is an unknown DukeException **/
System.out.println("There seems to be an error with Duke."
* Prints a message when a task is marked as done
* @param taskNumber Number of the task in TaskList
System.out.printf("Solid work! I've marked task %d as done.%n", taskNumber);
* Prints a message when a new task is added to TaskList
* @param taskType String representing the type of task
System.out.printf("Great! I've added your %s. Enter 'list' to see your tasks!%n", taskType);
* Prints a message when a task is deleted from TaskList
* @param taskNumber Number of task in TaskList
System.out.printf("Got it! I've removed task %d.%n", taskNumber);
* Prints a message to show the number of current tasks
* Parent class for all Duke-related exceptions
* Exception to indicate an unknown command entered by user
* Exception to indicate invalid task number entered by user
* e.g. User only has 3 tasks but enters 4
* Exception to indicate when user enters deadline without due date
* Exception to indicate when users enter event without start time
* e.g. event end of semester party
* Exception to indicate when user enters a task without a name
* Exception to indicate when the user forgets to enter task number
* A task that need to be done before a certain date
/** Date that the task needs to be done before **/
* @param endDate Date to complete task by
* Initializes a new Deadline with done property
* @param endDate Date to complete task by
* @param isDone Whether task is done or not

* Initializes a new Event with done property
